As O

In O

" " O
Toyota I-ORG

DTC I-ORG

" " O

( O

" " O

" " O

Section O
145 O
permits O

to O

" " O

or O
officers O

reasonably O
believed O
to O
be O
in O
or O
not O
opposed O
to O
the O
best O
interests O
of O
the O
corporation O
and O
" " O
with O
respect O
to O
any O
criminal O
action O
or O
proceeding O
" " O
had O
no O

to O
believe O

was O

. O

be O

Section O
102 O
( O
b O
) O
( O
7 O
) O
provides O
that O
a O
corporation O
may O
eliminate O
or O
limit O
the O
personal O

of O
a O
director O
to O
the O
corporation O
or O

stockholders O
for O

for O
breach O
of O
fiduciary O
duty O
as O
a O

" " O
provided O
that O
such O

shall O
not O

or O
limit O
the O

of O

( O

of O

of O

or O

" " O

which O

or O

of O

" " O
( O

) O
for O

or O

out O

other O

( O

. O

" " O

"77 453 404" O

Withdrawals O
Withdrawals O
during O
employment O
are O
permitted O
under O
certain O
circumstances O
. O

There O
are O
two O
types O
of O
withdrawals O
: O
hardship O
and O
non-hardship O
. O

A O
hardship O
withdrawal O
is O
available O
under O
limited O
circumstances O
" " O
which O
the O
participant O
must O
document O
" " O
and O
is O
paid O
in O
cash O
. O

A O
non-hardship O
withdrawal O
is O
available O
under O
certain O
circumstances O
" " O
depending O
on O
the O
participant O
s O
age O
" " O
length O
of O
Plan O
participation O
" " O
and/or O
type O
of O
account O
or O
sub-account O
involved O
. O

Before O
age O
70 O
" " O
a O
non-hardship O
withdrawal O
is O
paid O
in O
cash O
" " O
except O
that O
active O
participants O
who O
are O
at O
least O
age O
59 O
may O
elect O
to O

Participant O
Notes O
Receivable O
Generally O
" " O
active O
participants O
in O
the O
Plan O

for O
loans O
from O
the O
Plan O
. O

A O
maximum O
of O
2 O
outstanding O
loans O
is O
permitted O
at O

time O
. O

Interest O
rates O
on O

are O
generally O
calculated O
based O
on O
the O
prime O
rate O
as O
published O
in O
the O
Wall I-MISC
Street I-MISC
Journal I-MISC
on O
the O
last O
business O
day O
of O
the O
month O
prior O
to O
the O
month O
the O
loan O
was O
obtained O
. O

Interest O
rates O
on O
the O
loans O
are O
fixed O
. O

General O
purpose O

have O
a O
term O
of O
1 O
to O
5 O
years O
and O

residence O

of O
1 O
to O
15 O
years O
. O

The O
maximum O
loan O
amount O
that O
may O

is O
the O
lesser O
of O
50 O
% O
of O

participant O

account O
balance O
reduced O
by O
any O
outstanding O
loan O
balance O
" " O
or O
$ O
"50 000" O
reduced O
by O
the O
highest O
outstanding O
balance O
of O
loans O
under O
the O
Plan O
and O

Significant O
accounting O
policies O
of O
the O
Plan O
are O
summarized O
below O
: O
Basis O
of O
Accounting O
The O
financial O
statements O
are O
prepared O
on O
the O
accrual O
basis O
of O
accounting O
in O
accordance O
with O
U.S. I-LEGISLATION/ACT
generally I-LEGISLATION/ACT
accepted I-LEGISLATION/ACT
accounting I-LEGISLATION/ACT
principles I-LEGISLATION/ACT
( O
GAAP I-LEGISLATION/ACT
) O
. O

Revenues O
are O
recognized O
as O
earned O
. O

Benefits O
paid O
to O
plan O
participants O
are O
recorded O
when O
paid O
. O

All O
other O
expenses O
are O
recorded O
as O
incurred O
. O

Management O
Estimates O
The O
preparation O
of O
financial O
statements O
in O
conformity O
with O
GAAP I-LEGISLATION/ACT
requires O
management O
to O
make O
estimates O
and O
assumptions O
that O
affect O
the O
reported O
amounts O
of O
Plan O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
and O
disclosure O
of O
contingent O
liabilities O
at O
the O
date O
of O
the O
financial O
statements O
and O
the O
reported O
amounts O
of O
Plan O
additions O
and O
deductions O
during O
the O
reporting O
period O
. O

Actual O
results O
could O
differ O
from O
those O
estimates O
. O

Investment O
Valuation O
and O
Income O
Recognition O
Investments O
are O
carried O
at O
fair O
value O
. O

Fair O
value O
is O
the O
price O
that O
would O
be O
received O
to O
sell O
an O
asset O
or O
paid O
to O
transfer O
a O
liability O
in O
an O
orderly O
transaction O
between O
market O
participants O
at O
the O
measurement O
date O
( O
see O
Note O
6 O
: O
Fair O
Value O
Measurements O
) O
. O

Benefit O
responsive O
investment O
contracts O
are O
stated O
at O
fair O
value O
and O
are O
adjusted O
to O
contract O
value O
( O
which O

Investment O

( O
Continued O
) O

Realized O
gains O
or O

on O
investment O

are O

as O
the O
difference O
between O
proceeds O
received O
and O
cost O
. O

Cost O
is O
determined O
on O
the O
average O
cost O
basis O
. O

Net O

( O

) O
in O
fair O
value O
of O

the O
reversal O
of O
previously O
recognized O

( O

during O
the O
period O
. O

Investment O

basis O
. O

Interest O
income O

basis O
. O

Dividends O
are O

on O
the O
ex-dividend O
date O
. O

Participant O
Notes O
Receivable O

any O

The O

Value O
Fund O
generally O
consists O
of O
the O
following O
types O
of O

contracts O
( O
GICs O
) O
described O
below O
: O
Guaranteed O
Investment O
Contracts O
Traditional O
GICs O
are O
unsecured O
" " O
general O
account O
obligations O
of O
insurance O
companies O
. O

The O
obligation O
is O
backed O
by O
the O
general O
account O
assets O
of O
the O
insurance O
company O
that O
writes O
the O
investment O
contract O
. O

The O
crediting O
rate O
on O
this O
product O
is O
typically O
fixed O
for O
the O
life O
of O
the O
investment O
. O

Fair O
values O
of O
traditional O
GICs O
are O
calculated O
using O
the O
present O
value O
of O
the O
contract O
s O
future O
cash O
flow O
values O
discounted O
by O
comparable O
duration O
Wall I-MISC
Street I-MISC
Journal I-MISC
GIC I-MISC
Index I-MISC
rates O
. O

Separate O
account O
GICs O
are O
investments O
in O
a O
segregated O
account O
of O
assets O
maintained O
by O
an O
insurance O
company O
for O
the O
benefit O
of O
the O
investors O
. O

The O
total O
return O
of O
the O
segregated O
account O
assets O
supports O
the O
separate O
account O
GICs O
return O
. O

The O
crediting O
rate O
on O
this O
product O
will O
reset O
periodically O
and O
it O
will O
have O
an O
interest O
rate O
of O
not O
less O
than O
0 O
% O
. O

Fair O
values O
of O
separate O
account O
GICs O
are O
calculated O
using O
the O
market O
value O
provided O
by O
the O
insurance O
companies O
that O
manage O
the O
underlying O
assets O
of O
the O
product O
. O

Maturity O
Synthetic O
Guaranteed O
Investment O
Contracts O
General O
fixed O
maturity O
synthetic O
GICs O
consist O
of O
an O
asset O
or O
collection O
of O
assets O
that O
are O

by O
the O
fund O
( O
or O
plan O
) O
and O

benefit O
responsive O
" " O
book O
value O
wrap O
contract O
purchased O
for O
the O
portfolio O
. O

The O
wrap O
contract O
provides O

value O
accounting O
for O
the O
asset O
and O
assures O
that O
book O
value O
benefit O
responsive O
payments O
will O
be O
made O
for O
participant O
directed O
withdrawals O
. O

The O

rate O
of O
the O
contract O
is O
set O
at O
the O
start O
of O
the O
contract O
and O
typically O
resets O
every O
quarter O
. O

Generally O
" " O
fixed O
maturity O
synthetics O
are O
held O
to O
maturity O
. O

The O
initial O
crediting O
rate O
is O

on O
the O
market O

rates O
at O
the O
time O

initial O

is O

not O

0 O
% O
. O

Synthetic O

Contracts O

consist O
of O

bankruptcy O
remote O

the O

of O
the O
fund O
( O
or O
plan O
) O
. O

The O
contract O
is O

responsive O
and O
provides O
next O
day O
liquidity O
at O
book O
value O
. O

The O
crediting O
rate O
on O

product O

every O
quarter O

current O
market O
index O
rates O
at O
that O

and O

. O

The O

the O

for O

. O

of O

discounted O
by O

swap O
rates O
. O

Constant O
Duration O
Synthetic O
Guaranteed O
Investment O
Contracts O
Constant O
duration O
synthetic O
GICs O
consist O
of O
a O

of O
securities O

by O

( O
or O
plan O
) O

" " O

value O
wrap O

. O

The O

amortizes O
gains O
and O

of O

securities O
over O
the O

" " O
and O

that O

value O

will O

for O

. O

The O
crediting O
rate O
on O
a O

duration O
synthetic O
GIC O
resets O
every O
quarter O
based O
on O
the O
book O
value O
of O
the O
contract O
" " O
the O
market O
yield O
of O
the O
underlying O
assets O
" " O
the O
market O
value O
of O
the O
underlying O
assets O
and O
the O
average O
duration O
of O
the O
underlying O
assets O
. O

The O
crediting O
rate O
aims O
at O
converging O
the O
book O
value O
of O
the O
contract O
and O
the O
market O
value O
of O
the O
underlying O
portfolio O
over O
the O
duration O
of O
the O
contract O
and O
therefore O
will O
be O
affected O
by O
movements O
in O
interest O
rates O
and/or O
changes O
in O
the O
market O
value O
of O
the O
underlying O
portfolio O
. O

The O
initial O
crediting O
rate O
is O
established O
based O
on O
the O
market O
interest O
rates O
at O
the O
time O
the O
underlying O
portfolio O
is O
first O

together O

ASC I-LEGISLATION/ACT
820 O
" " O
Fair I-MISC
Value I-MISC
Measurements I-MISC
and I-MISC
Disclosures I-MISC
" " O
provides O
the O
framework O
for O
measuring O
fair O
value O
. O

That O
framework O
provides O
a O
fair O
value O
hierarchy O
that O
prioritizes O
the O
inputs O
to O
valuation O
techniques O
used O
to O
measure O
fair O
value O
. O

The O
hierarchy O
gives O
the O
highest O
priority O
to O
unadjusted O
quoted O
prices O
in O
active O
markets O
for O
identical O
assets O
or O
liabilities O
( O
level O
1 O
measurements O
) O
and O
the O
lowest O
priority O
to O
unobservable O
inputs O
( O
level O
3 O
measurements O
) O
. O

The O
three O
levels O
of O
the O
fair O
value O
hierarchy O
under O
ASC O
820 O
are O
described O
below O
: O

Merrill I-ORG
Lynch I-ORG
& I-ORG
Co. I-ORG
" " I-ORG
Inc. I-ORG

The O
asset O
s O
or O
liability O
s O
fair O
value O
measurement O
level O
within O
the O
fair O
value O
hierarchy O
is O
based O
on O
the O
lowest O
level O
of O
any O
input O
that O
is O
significant O
to O
the O
fair O
value O
measurement O
. O

Valuation O

used O
need O
to O
maximize O
the O
use O
of O
observable O
inputs O
and O
minimize O
the O
use O
of O
unobservable O

. O

" " O

Adjusted O

represents O

income O
before O
interest O
expense O
" " O

expense O
" " O

of O

" " O

" " O

on O

and O

. O

EBITDA O
is O
not O
required O
by O
" " O
or O

in O

with O
" " O
generally I-LEGISLATION/ACT
accepted I-LEGISLATION/ACT
accounting I-LEGISLATION/ACT
principles I-LEGISLATION/ACT
in O
the O
United I-LOC
States I-LOC
" " O

GAAP I-LEGISLATION/ACT
. O

Adjusted O
EBITDA O
is O
a O
performance O
measure O
that O
is O
used O
by O

management O
" " O
and O

believe O
is O
commonly O

and O

by O

and O

" " O
to O
evaluate O
a O

the O

of O

" " O

" " O

( O

. O

Adjusted O

has O
limitations O
as O

" " O

should O
not O

Some O

are O
: O

Because O
of O
these O
limitations O
" " O

not O

a O

of O

results O

of O

AutoNation I-ORG
" " I-ORG

" " O
through O
its O

" " O

the O

in O

. O

Floorplan O

Definitions O
The O
indenture O
contains O
the O
following O
defined O
terms O
: O
Affiliate O
means O
" " O
as O
to O
any O
Person O
" " O

other O
Person O
who O
" " O

" " O

to O
Person O

term O
control O
means O

" " O
directly O
or O
indirectly O
" " O
of O
the O
power O
to O
direct O
or O

direction O
of O
the O
management O
and O
policies O
of O
a O
Person O
" " O
whether O
through O
the O

of O

securities O
" " O
by O

. O

Short O
Positions O
In O
connection O
with O
the O
offering O
" " O
the O
underwriters O
may O
purchase O
and O
sell O
the O
notes O
in O
the O
open O
market O
. O

These O
transactions O
may O
include O
short O
sales O
and O
purchases O
on O
the O
open O
market O
to O
cover O
positions O
created O
by O
short O
sales O
. O

Short O
sales O
involve O
the O
sale O
by O
the O
underwriters O
of O
a O
greater O
principal O
amount O
of O
notes O
than O
they O
are O
required O
to O
purchase O
in O
the O
offering O
. O

The O
underwriters O
must O
close O
out O
any O
short O
position O
by O
purchasing O
notes O
in O
the O
open O
market O
. O

A O
short O
position O
is O
more O
likely O
to O
be O
created O
if O
the O
underwriters O
are O
concerned O
that O
there O
may O
be O
downward O
pressure O
on O
the O
price O
of O
the O
notes O
in O
the O
open O
market O
after O
pricing O
that O
could O
adversely O
affect O
investors O
who O
purchase O
in O
the O
offering O
. O

The O
underwriters O
also O
may O
impose O
a O
penalty O
bid O
. O

This O
occurs O
when O
a O
particular O
underwriter O
repays O
to O
the O
underwriters O
a O
portion O
of O
the O
underwriting O
discount O
received O
by O
it O
because O
the O
representatives O
have O
repurchased O
notes O
sold O
by O
or O
for O
the O
account O
of O
such O
underwriter O
in O
stabilizing O
or O
short O
covering O
transactions O
. O

Similar O
to O
other O
purchase O
transactions O
" " O
the O
underwriters O
purchases O
to O
cover O
the O
syndicate O
short O
sales O
may O
have O
the O
effect O
of O
raising O
or O
maintaining O
the O
market O
price O
of O
the O
notes O
or O
preventing O
or O
retarding O
a O
decline O
in O
the O
market O
price O
of O
the O
notes O
. O

As O
a O
result O
" " O
the O
price O
of O
the O
notes O
may O
be O
higher O
than O
the O
price O
that O
might O
otherwise O
exist O
in O
the O
open O
market O
. O

Neither O
we O
nor O
any O
of O
the O
underwriters O
make O
any O
representation O
or O
prediction O
as O
to O
the O
direction O
or O
magnitude O
of O
any O
effect O
that O
the O
transactions O
described O
above O
may O
have O
on O
the O
price O
of O
the O
notes O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O

nor O

these O

AutoNation I-ORG
" " I-ORG
Inc. I-ORG
" " O
through O
its O
subsidiaries O
" " O
is O
the O
largest O
automotive O
retailer O
in O
the O
United I-LOC
States I-LOC
. O

As O
of O
December O
31 O
" " O
2009 O
" " O

owned O
and O

246 O
new O
vehicle O

from O
203 O

in O

" " O

. O

Our O

" " O

Certain O
Anti-Takeover O
Provisions O
of O
Our O
Certificate O
of O

the O
DGCL I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Certain O

in O
our O
Certificate O
of O
Incorporation O
and O
By-Laws O
and O
the O
DGCL I-LEGISLATION/ACT
may O

of O

" " O

or O
discouraging O
another O
party O
from O

us O
. O

These O
provisions O
" " O
which O
are O
summarized O
below O
" " O
are O
expected O
to O
discourage O

takeover O
practices O
and O

takeover O

. O

These O
provisions O
are O

designed O
to O
encourage O

to O

of O
us O
to O
first O

with O
our O
Board O
. O

Notice O
of O
Shareholder O

or O
Nominations O

by O
a O
shareholder O
who O
was O
a O
shareholder O
of O
record O
on O
the O
record O
date O
for O
the O
meeting O
" " O
who O
is O
entitled O
to O
vote O
at O
the O
meeting O
and O
who O
has O
given O
to O
our O
Corporate O
Secretary O
timely O
written O
notice O
" " O
in O
proper O
form O
" " O
of O
the O
shareholder O
s O
intention O
to O
bring O
that O
proposal O
or O
nomination O
before O
the O
meeting O
. O

In O
addition O
to O
certain O
other O
applicable O
requirements O
" " O
for O
a O
shareholder O
proposal O
or O
nomination O
to O
be O
properly O
brought O
before O
an O
annual O
meeting O
by O
a O
shareholder O
" " O
such O
shareholder O
generally O
must O
have O
given O
notice O
thereof O
in O
proper O
written O
form O
to O
our O
Corporate O
Secretary O
not O
less O
than O
90 O
days O
nor O
more O
than O
120 O
days O
prior O
to O
the O
anniversary O
date O
of O
the O
immediately O
preceding O
annual O
meeting O
of O
shareholders O
. O

Our O
By-Laws O
may O
have O
the O
effect O
of O
precluding O
the O
conduct O
of O
certain O
business O
at O
a O
meeting O
if O
the O
proper O
procedures O
are O
not O
followed O
or O
may O
discourage O
or O
defer O

potential O

from O
conducting O

of O
proxies O
to O
elect O
its O

slate O
of O
directors O
or O
otherwise O

to O
obtain O

of O
us O
. O

Special O
Meetings O
of O
Shareholders O
Our O
By-Laws O
deny O
shareholders O
the O
right O
to O
call O
a O
special O
meeting O
of O
shareholders O
. O

Our O
By-Laws O
provide O
that O
only O
the O
Board O
may O
call O
special O
meetings O
of O
the O
shareholders O
. O

Stockholders O
are O
permitted O
under O
our O
By-Laws O
to O
act O
by O
written O
consent O
in O
lieu O
of O
a O
meeting O
. O

Delaware I-LEGISLATION/ACT
General I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Corporation I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Law I-LEGISLATION/ACT
We O
are O
a O
Delaware I-LOC
corporation O
and O
consequently O
are O
also O
subject O
to O
certain O
anti-takeover O
provisions O
of O
the O
DGCL I-LEGISLATION/ACT
. O

Subject O
to O
certain O
exceptions O
" " O
Section O
203 O
of O
the O
DGCL I-LEGISLATION/ACT
prevents O
a O
publicly O
held O
Delaware I-LOC
corporation O
from O
engaging O
in O
a O
business O
combination O
with O
any O
interested O
stockholder O
for O
three O
years O
following O
the O
date O
that O
the O
person O
became O
an O
interested O
stockholder O
" " O
unless O
the O
interested O
stockholder O
attained O
such O
status O
with O
the O
approval O
of O
our O
Board O
or O
unless O
the O
business O
combination O
is O
approved O
in O
a O
prescribed O
manner O
. O

A O
business O
combination O
includes O
" " O
among O
other O
things O
" " O
a O
merger O
or O
consolidation O
involving O
us O
and O
the O
interested O
stockholder O
and O
the O
sale O
of O
more O
than O
10 O
% O
of O
our O
assets O
. O

In O
general O
" " O
an O
interested O
stockholder O
is O
any O
entity O
or O
person O
beneficially O
owning O
15 O
% O
or O
more O
of O
our O
outstanding O
voting O
stock O
and O
any O
entity O
or O
person O
affiliated O
with O
or O
controlling O
or O
controlled O
by O
such O
entity O
or O
person O
. O

Section O
203 O
makes O
it O
more O
difficult O
for O
an O
interested O
stockholder O
to O
effect O
various O
business O
combinations O
with O
a O
corporation O
for O
a O
three-year O
period O
. O

This O
statute O
could O
prohibit O
or O
delay O
mergers O
or O
other O
takeover O
or O
change O
in O
control O
attempts O
not O
approved O
in O
advance O
by O
our O
Board O
and O
as O
a O
result O
could O
discourage O
attempts O
to O
acquire O
us O
" " O
which O
could O
depress O
the O
market O
price O
of O
our O
common O
stock O
. O

B. O
SEC I-GOVERNMENT
v. O
J.P. I-ORG
Morgan I-ORG
Securities I-ORG
LLC I-ORG
( O
f/k/a/ O
J.P. I-ORG
Morgan I-ORG
Securities I-ORG
Inc. I-ORG
) O

Morgan I-ORG
Securities I-ORG
executed O
on O
June O
17 O
" " O
2011 O
" " O
a O
Consent O
of O
Defendant O
J.P. I-ORG
Morgan I-ORG
Securities I-ORG
( O
the O
 O
Consent O
 O
) O
" " O
in O
which O
J.P. I-ORG
Morgan I-ORG
Securities I-ORG
neither O
admitted O
nor O
denied O
any O
of O
the O
allegations O
( O
except O
as O
to O
personal O
and O
subject O
matter O
jurisdiction O
) O
in O
a O
complaint O
filed O
by O
the O
Commission O
" " O
but O
in O
which O
it O
consented O
to O
the O
entry O
of O
a O
final O
judgment O
( O
 O
Final O
Judgment O
 O
) O
against O
it O
by O
the O
United I-COURT
States I-COURT
District I-COURT
Court I-COURT
for I-COURT
the I-COURT
Southern I-COURT
District I-COURT
of I-COURT
New I-COURT
York I-COURT
( O
the O
 O
Court O
 O
) O
. O

The O
Commission O
approved O
the O
Consent O
" " O
and O
on O
June O
21 O
" " O
2011 O
" " O
the O
Commission O
filed O
a O
complaint O
( O
the O
 O
Complaint O
 O
) O
against O
J.P. I-ORG
Morgan I-ORG
Securities I-ORG
in O
the O
Court O
. O

The O
conduct O
of O
J.P. I-ORG
Morgan I-ORG
Securities I-ORG
alleged O
in O
the O
Complaint O
involved O
an O
offering O
of O
a O
largely O
synthetic O
collateralized O
debt O
obligation O
( O
 O
CDO O
 O
) O
whose O
portfolio O
consisted O
primarily O
of O
credit O
default O
swaps O
( O
 O
CDS O
 O
) O
referencing O
other O
CDO O
securities O
to O
qualified O
institutional O
buyers O
in O
reliance O
on O
the O
exemption O
from O
registration O
under O
the O
Securities I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Act I-LEGISLATION/ACT
of I-LEGISLATION/ACT
1933 I-LEGISLATION/ACT
( O
 O
Securities I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Act I-LEGISLATION/ACT
 O
) O
provided O
by O
Rule O
144A O
thereunder O
and O
to O
non-U.S. I-MISC
persons O
in O
reliance O
on O
the O
safe O
harbor O
from O
registration O
provided O
by O
Regulation O
S O
thereunder O
. O

The O
Complaint O
alleged O
that O
J.P. I-ORG
Morgan I-ORG
Securities I-ORG
represented O
in O
marketing O
materials O
that O
the O
collateral O
manager O
selected O
the O
CDO O
 O
s O
investment O
portfolio O
but O
failed O
to O
disclose O
that O
the O
hedge O
fund O
that O
purchased O
the O
subordinated O
notes O
( O
or O
 O
equity O
 O
) O
" " O
which O
also O
took O
the O
short O
position O
on O
roughly O
half O
of O
the O
portfolio O
 O
s O
assets O
" " O
played O
a O
significant O
role O
in O
the O
selection O
process O
. O

Specifically O
" " O
the O
Complaint O
alleged O
that O
although O
the O
offering O
circular O
for O
the O
CDO O
did O
have O
a O
risk O
factor O
that O
disclosed O
that O
a O
noteholder O
may O
hold O
a O
short O
position O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
referenced O
CDOs O
or O
buy O
credit O
protection O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
referenced O
CDOs O
" " O
and O
that O
a O
noteholder O
may O
act O
with O
respect O
to O
those O
positions O
 O
without O
regard O
to O
whether O
any O
such O
action O
might O
have O
an O
adverse O
effect O
on O
the O
Issuer O
" " O
the O
Noteholders O
" " O
related O
Reference O
Entity O
or O
any O
Reference O
Obligation O
" " O
 O
this O
disclosure O
did O
not O
indicate O
that O
such O
a O
noteholder O
was O
involved O
in O
the O
portfolio O
selection O
process O
. O

The O
Final O
Judgment O
wouldrestrain O
and O
enjoin O
J.P. I-ORG
Morgan I-ORG
Securities I-ORG
from O
violating O
Sections O
17 O
( O
a O
) O
( O
2 O
) O
and O
( O
3 O
) O
of O
the O
Securities I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Act I-LEGISLATION/ACT
in O
the O
offer O
or O
sale O
of O
any O
security O
or O
security-based O
swap O
agreement O
( O
the O
 O
Injunction O
 O
) O
" " O
impose O
liability O
on O
J.P. I-ORG
Morgan I-ORG
Securities I-ORG
for O
payment O
of O
disgorgement O
of O
$ O
18.6 O
million O
with O
prejudgment O
interest O
thereon O
in O
the O
amount O
of O
$ O
2 O

About O
BlackRock I-ORG

Investment O
Objective O
The O
investment O
objective O
of O
the O
BlackRock I-ORG
High I-ORG
Yield I-ORG
Bond I-ORG
Portfolio I-ORG
( O
the O
High I-ORG
Yield I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
or O
the O
Fund O
) O
is O
to O
seek O
to O
maximize O
total O
return O
" " O
consistent O
with O
income O
generation O
and O
prudent O
investment O
management O
. O

Fees O
and O
Expenses O
of O
the O
Fund O

that O

. O

Example O
: O
This O
Example O
is O
intended O
to O
help O
you O

the O

of O

in O
the O
Fund O
with O
the O

of O

in O
other O

. O

The O
Example O
assumes O
that O
you O

$ O
"10 000" O
in O

for O
the O
time O
periods O
indicated O
and O

. O

The O

also O

that O

a O
5 O
% O
return O
each O

and O
that O

Fund O

remain O

. O

Although O
your O

costs O
may O
be O
higher O
or O
lower O
" " O
based O

these O

your O

would O
be O
: O

Portfolio O
Turnover O
: O
The O
Fund O
pays O
transaction O
costs O
" " O
such O
as O
commissions O
" " O
when O
it O
buys O
and O
sells O
securities O
( O
or O
turns O
over O
its O
portfolio O
) O
. O

A O
higher O
portfolio O
turnover O
may O
indicate O
higher O
transaction O
costs O
and O
may O
result O
in O
higher O
taxes O
when O
shares O
are O
held O
in O
a O
taxable O
account O
. O

These O
costs O
" " O
which O
are O
not O
reflected O
in O
annual O
fund O
operating O
expenses O
or O
in O
the O
example O
" " O
affect O
the O
Fund O
s O
performance O
. O

During O
the O
most O
recent O
fiscal O
year O
" " O
the O
Fund O
s O
portfolio O
turnover O
rate O
was O
99 O
% O
of O
the O
average O
value O
of O
its O
portfolio O
. O

Principal O
Investment O
Strategies O
of O
the O
Fund O
The O
High I-ORG
Yield I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
invests O
primarily O
in O
non-investment O
grade O
bonds O
with O
maturities O
of O
ten O
years O
or O
less O
. O

The O
High I-ORG
Yield I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
normally O
invests O
at O
least O
80 O
% O
of O
its O
assets O
in O
high O
yield O
bonds O
. O

The O
high O
yield O
securities O
( O
commonly O
called O
junk O
bonds O
) O
acquired O
by O
the O
High I-ORG
Yield I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
will O
generally O
be O
in O
the O
lower O
rating O
categories O
of O
the O
major O
rating O
agencies O
( O
BB O
or O
lower O
by O
Standard I-ORG
& I-ORG
Poor I-ORG
s I-ORG
or O
Ba O
or O
lower O
by O
Moody I-ORG
s I-ORG
) O
or O
will O
be O
determined O
by O
the O
High I-ORG
Yield I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
management O
team O
to O
be O
of O
similar O
quality O
. O

Split O
rated O
bonds O
will O
be O
considered O
to O
have O
the O
higher O
credit O
rating O
. O

The O
High I-ORG
Yield I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
may O
invest O
up O
to O
10 O
% O
of O
its O
assets O
in O
non-dollar O
denominated O
bonds O
of O
issuers O
located O
outside O
of O
the O
United I-LOC
States I-LOC
. O

The O
High I-ORG
Yield I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
s O
investment O
in O
non-dollar O
denominated O
bonds O
may O
be O
on O
a O
currency O
hedged O
or O
unhedged O
basis O
. O

To O
add O
additional O
diversification O
" " O
the O
management O
team O
can O
invest O
in O
a O
wide O
range O
of O
securities O
including O
corporate O
bonds O
" " O

investments O
" " O
collateralized O
bond O
obligations O
" " O
bank O
loans O
and O
mortgage-backed O
and O
asset-backed O
securities O
. O

The O
High I-ORG
Yield I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
can O
also O
invest O
" " O
to O
the O
extent O
consistent O
with O
its O
investment O
goal O
" " O
in O
non-U.S. I-MISC
and O
emerging O
market O
securities O
and O

. O

The O
High I-ORG
Yield I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
may O
invest O
in O
securities O
of O
any O
rating O
" " O
and O
may O
invest O
up O
to O
10 O
% O
of O
its O
assets O
( O
measured O
at O
the O

of O

) O
in O
distressed O
securities O
that O
are O
in O
default O
or O
the O

of O
which O
are O
in O

. O

The O
High I-ORG
Yield I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
may O
buy O
or O
sell O
options O
or O
futures O
on O
a O
security O
or O
an O
index O
of O
securities O
" " O
or O
enter O
into O
credit O
default O
swaps O
and O
interest O
rate O
or O
foreign O
currency O
transactions O
" " O
including O
swaps O
( O
collectively O
" " O
commonly O
known O
as O
derivatives O
) O
. O

The O
High I-ORG
Yield I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
may O
seek O
to O
obtain O
market O
exposure O
to O
the O
securities O
in O
which O

primarily O

by O

of O

( O
such O

) O
. O

High I-ORG

Fund I-ORG
may O

in O

and O

trading O
of O
portfolio O
securities O
to O
achieve O
its O
primary O

. O

Principal O
Risks O
of O
Investing O
in O
the O
Fund O
Risk O
is O
inherent O
in O
all O
investing O
. O

The O
value O
of O
your O
investment O
in O
the O
Fund O
" " O
as O
well O
as O
the O
amount O
of O
return O
you O
receive O
on O
your O
investment O
" " O
may O
fluctuate O
significantly O
from O
day O
to O
day O
and O
over O
time O
. O

You O
may O
lose O
part O
or O
all O
of O
your O
investment O
in O
the O
Fund O
or O
your O
investment O
may O
not O
perform O
as O
well O
as O
other O
similar O
investments O
. O

The O
following O
is O
a O
summary O
description O
of O
certain O
risks O
of O
investing O
in O
the O
Fund O
. O

Bank O
Loan O
Risk O
 O
The O
market O
for O
bank O
loans O
may O
not O
be O
highly O
liquid O
and O
a O
Fund O
may O
have O
difficulty O
selling O
them O
. O

These O
investments O
expose O
a O
Fund O
to O
the O
credit O
risk O
of O
both O
the O
financial O
institution O
and O
the O
underlying O
borrower O
. O

Call O
Risk O
 O
Call O
risk O
is O
the O
risk O
that O
" " O
during O
a O
period O
of O
falling O
interest O
rates O
" " O
the O
issuer O
may O
redeem O
a O
security O
by O
repaying O
it O
early O
" " O
which O
may O
reduce O
the O
Fund O
s O
income O
if O
the O
proceeds O
are O
reinvested O
at O
lower O
interest O
rates O
. O

Collateralized O
Bond O
Obligation O
Risk O
 O
The O
pool O
of O
high O
yield O
securities O
underlying O
collateralized O
bond O
obligations O
is O
typically O
separated O
in O
groupings O
called O
tranches O
representing O
different O
degrees O
of O
credit O
quality O
. O

The O
higher O
quality O
tranches O
have O
greater O
degrees O
of O
protection O
and O
pay O
lower O
interest O
rates O
. O

The O
lower O
tranches O
" " O
with O
greater O
risk O
" " O
pay O
higher O
interest O
rates O
. O

Credit O
Risk O
 O
Credit O
risk O
refers O
to O
the O
possibility O
that O
the O
issuer O
of O
a O
security O
will O
not O
be O
able O
to O
make O
payments O
of O
interest O
and O
principal O
when O
due O
. O

Changes O
in O
an O
issuer O
s O
credit O
rating O
or O
the O
market O
s O
perception O
of O
an O
issuer O
s O
creditworthiness O
may O
also O
affect O
the O
value O
of O
the O
Fund O
s O
investment O
in O
that O
issuer O
. O

Derivatives O
Risk O
 O
The O
Fund O
s O
use O
of O
derivatives O
may O
reduce O
the O
Fund O
s O
returns O
and/or O
increase O
volatility O
. O

Volatility O
is O
defined O
as O
the O
characteristic O
of O
a O
security O
" " O
an O
index O
or O
a O
market O
to O
fluctuate O
significantly O
in O
price O
within O
a O
short O
time O
period O
. O

A O
risk O
of O
the O
Fund O
s O
use O
of O
derivatives O
is O
that O
the O
fluctuations O
in O
their O
values O
may O
not O
correlate O
perfectly O
with O
the O
overall O
securities O
markets O
. O

Distressed O
Securities O
Risk O
 O
Distressed O
securities O
are O
speculative O
and O
involve O
substantial O
risks O
in O
addition O
to O
the O
risks O
of O
investing O
in O
junk O
bonds O
. O

The O
Fund O
will O
generally O
not O
receive O
interest O
payments O
on O
the O
distressed O
securities O
and O
may O
incur O
costs O
to O
protect O
its O
investment O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
distressed O
securities O
involve O
the O
substantial O
risk O
that O
principal O
will O
not O
be O
repaid O
. O

Distressed O
securities O
and O
any O
securities O
received O
in O
an O
exchange O
for O
such O
securities O
may O
be O
subject O
to O
restrictions O
on O
resale O
. O

Dollar O
Rolls O
Risk O
 O
Dollar O
rolls O
involve O
the O
risk O
that O
the O
market O
value O
of O
the O
securities O
that O
the O
Fund O
is O
committed O
to O
buy O
may O
decline O
below O
the O
price O
of O
the O
securities O
the O
Fund O
has O
sold O
. O

These O
transactions O
may O
involve O
leverage O
. O

Emerging O
Markets O
Risk O
 O
Emerging O
markets O
are O
riskier O
than O
more O
developed O
markets O
because O
they O
tend O
to O
develop O
unevenly O
and O
may O
never O
fully O
develop O
. O

Investments O
in O
emerging O
markets O
may O
be O
considered O
speculative O
. O

Emerging O
markets O
are O
more O
likely O
to O
experience O
hyperinflation O
and O
currency O
devaluations O
" " O
which O
adversely O
affect O
returns O
to O
U.S. I-LOC
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
many O
emerging O
securities O
markets O
have O
far O
lower O
trading O
volumes O
and O
less O
liquidity O
than O
developed O
markets O
. O

Foreign O
Securities O
Risk O
 O
Foreign O
investments O
often O
involve O
special O
risks O
not O
present O
in O
U.S. I-LOC
investments O
that O
can O
increase O
the O
chances O
that O
the O
Fund O
will O
lose O
money O
. O

These O
risks O
include O
: O

High O
Portfolio O
Turnover O
Risk O
 O
The O
Fund O
may O
engage O
in O
active O
and O
frequent O
trading O
of O
its O
portfolio O
securities O
. O

High O
portfolio O
turnover O
( O
more O
than O
100 O
% O
) O
may O
result O
in O
increased O
transaction O
costs O
to O
the O
Fund O
" " O
including O
brokerage O
commissions O
" " O
dealer O
mark-ups O
and O
other O
transaction O
costs O
on O
the O
sale O
of O
the O
securities O
and O
on O
reinvestment O
in O
other O
securities O
. O

The O
sale O
of O
Fund O
portfolio O
securities O
may O
result O
in O
the O
realization O
and O
distribution O
to O
shareholders O
of O
higher O
capital O
gains O
or O
losses O
as O
compared O
to O
a O
fund O
with O
less O
active O
trading O
policies O
. O

Given O
the O
frequency O
of O
sales O
" " O
such O
gain O
or O
loss O
will O
likely O
be O
short-term O
capital O
gain O
or O
loss O
and O
would O
increase O
an O
investor O
s O
tax O
liability O
unless O
shares O
are O
held O
through O
a O
tax-deferred O
or O
exempt O
vehicle O
. O

These O
effects O
of O
higher O
than O
normal O
portfolio O
turnover O
may O
adversely O
affect O
Fund O
performance O
. O

Interest O
Rate O
Risk O
 O
Interest O
rate O
risk O
is O
the O
risk O
that O
prices O
of O
bonds O
and O
other O
fixed-income O
securities O
will O
increase O
as O
interest O
rates O
fall O
" " O
and O
decrease O
as O
interest O
rates O
rise O
. O

Junk O
Bonds O
Risk O
 O
Although O
junk O
bonds O
generally O
pay O
higher O
rates O
of O
interest O
than O
investment O
grade O
bonds O
" " O
junk O
bonds O
are O
high O
risk O
investments O
that O
may O
cause O
income O
and O
principal O
losses O
for O
the O
Fund O
. O

Leverage O
Risk O
 O
Some O
transactions O
may O
give O
rise O
to O
a O
form O
of O
leverage O
. O

These O
transactions O
may O
include O
" " O
among O
others O
" " O
derivatives O
" " O
and O
may O
expose O
the O
Fund O
to O
greater O
risk O
and O
increase O
its O
costs O
. O

To O
mitigate O
leverage O
risk O
" " O
the O
Fund O
management O
team O
will O
segregate O
liquid O
assets O
on O
the O
books O
of O
the O
Fund O
or O
otherwise O
cover O
the O
transactions O
. O

The O
use O
of O
leverage O
may O
cause O
the O
Fund O
to O
liquidate O
portfolio O
positions O
when O
it O
may O
not O
be O
advantageous O
to O
do O
so O
to O
satisfy O
its O
obligations O
or O
to O
meet O
segregation O
requirements O
. O

Increases O
and O
decreases O
in O
the O
value O
of O
the O
Fund O
s O
portfolio O
will O
be O
magnified O
when O
the O
Fund O
uses O
leverage O
. O

Liquidity O
Risk O
 O
Liquidity O
risk O
refers O
to O
the O
possibility O
that O
it O
may O
be O
difficult O
or O
impossible O
to O
sell O
certain O
positions O
at O
an O
acceptable O
price O
. O

Market O
Risk O
and O
Selection O
Risk O
 O
Market O
risk O
is O
the O
risk O
that O
one O
or O
more O
markets O
in O
which O
the O
Fund O
invests O
will O
go O
down O
in O
value O
" " O
including O
the O
possibility O
that O
the O
markets O
will O
go O
down O
sharply O
and O
unpredictably O
. O

Selection O
risk O
is O
the O
risk O
that O
the O
securities O
selected O
by O
Fund O
management O
will O
underperform O
the O
markets O
" " O
the O
relevant O
indices O
or O
the O
securities O
selected O
by O
other O
funds O
with O
similar O
investment O
objectives O
and O
investment O
strategies O
. O

This O
means O
you O
may O
lose O
money O
. O

Mezzanine O
Securities O
Risk O
 O
Mezzanine O
securities O
carry O
the O
risk O
that O
the O
issuer O
will O
not O
be O
able O
to O
meet O
its O
obligations O
and O
that O
the O
equity O
securities O
purchased O
with O
the O
mezzanine O
investments O
may O
lose O
value O
. O

Mortgage- O
and O
Asset-Backed O
Securities O
Risks O
 O
Mortgage- O
and O
asset-backed O
securities O
represent O
interests O
in O
pools O
of O
mortgages O
or O
other O
assets O
" " O
including O
consumer O
loans O
or O
receivables O
held O
in O
trust O
. O

Mortgage-backed O
securities O
are O
subject O
to O
prepayment O
risk O
and O
extension O
risk O
. O

Prepayment O
risk O
is O
the O
risk O
that O
" " O
when O
interest O
rates O
fall O
" " O
certain O
types O
of O
obligations O
will O
be O
paid O
off O
by O
the O
obligor O
more O
quickly O
than O
originally O
anticipated O
and O
the O
Fund O
may O
have O
to O
invest O
the O
proceeds O
in O
securities O
with O
lower O
yields O
. O

Extension O
risk O
is O
the O
risk O
that O
" " O
when O
interest O
rates O
rise O
" " O
certain O
obligations O
will O
be O
paid O
off O
by O
the O
obligor O
more O
slowly O
than O
anticipated O
causing O
the O
value O
of O
these O
securities O
to O
fall O
. O

Small O
movements O
in O
interest O
rates O
( O
both O
increases O
and O
decreases O
) O
may O
quickly O
and O
significantly O
reduce O
the O
value O
of O
certain O
mortgage-backed O
securities O
. O

These O
securities O
also O
are O
subject O
to O
risk O
of O
default O
on O
the O
underlying O
mortgage O
" " O
particularly O
during O
periods O
of O
economic O
downturn O
. O

Repurchase O
Agreements O
" " O
Purchase O
and O
Sale O
Contracts O
Risks O
 O
If O
the O
other O
party O
to O
a O
repurchase O
agreement O
or O
purchase O
and O
sale O
contract O
defaults O
on O
its O
obligation O
under O
the O
agreement O
" " O
the O
Fund O
may O
suffer O
delays O
and O
incur O
costs O
or O
lose O
money O
in O
exercising O
its O
rights O
under O
the O
agreement O
. O

If O
the O
seller O
fails O
to O
repurchase O
the O
security O
in O
either O
situation O
and O
the O
market O
value O
of O
the O
security O
declines O
" " O
the O
Fund O
may O
lose O
money O
. O

Reverse O
Repurchase O
Agreements O
Risk O
 O
Reverse O
repurchase O
agreements O
involve O
the O
sale O
of O
securities O
held O
by O
the O
Fund O
with O
an O
agreement O
to O
repurchase O
the O
securities O
at O
an O
agreed-upon O
price O
" " O
date O
and O
interest O
payment O
. O

Reverse O
repurchase O
agreements O
involve O
the O
risk O
that O
the O
other O
party O
may O
fail O
to O
return O
the O
securities O
in O
a O
timely O
manner O
or O
at O
all O
. O

The O
Fund O
could O
lose O
money O
if O
it O
is O
unable O
to O
recover O
the O
securities O
and O
the O
value O
of O
the O
collateral O
held O
by O
the O
Fund O
" " O
including O
the O
value O
of O
the O
investments O
made O
with O
cash O
collateral O
" " O
is O
less O
than O
the O
value O
of O
securities O
. O

These O
events O
could O
also O
trigger O
adverse O
tax O
consequences O
to O
the O
Fund O
. O

On O

5 O
" " O
2009 O
" " O
we O
completed O
a O
sublicense O
agreement O
with O
EWT I-ORG
Americas I-ORG
. O

The O
complete O
agreement O
is O
available O
on-line O
as O
filed O
with O
the O
SEC I-GOVERNMENT
. O

Summary O
terms O
of O
the O
agreement O
were O
: O

The O
sublicense O
agreement O
gave O
AWE O
a O
royalty O
of O
2.5 O
% O
of O
sales O
revenue O
and O
12.5 O
% O
of O
contribution O
margin O
on O
all O
sales O
to O
companies O
listed O
on O
exhibit O
A O
of O
the O
agreement O
over O
the O
next O
5 O
years O
. O

The O
royalty O
payments O
were O
capped O
at O
$ O
28 O
million O
. O

EWT O
Americas O
took O
over O
all O
AWE O
projects O
except O
two O
and O
was O
completing O
these O
two O
projects O
for O
our O
company O
. O

The O
costs O
to O
complete O
these O
two O
projects O
plus O
additional O
monies O
owed O
to O
EWT O
for O
materials O
was O
being O
taken O
out O
of O
our O
royalty O
payments O
at O
the O

Risks O
Related O
To O
Our O
Company O
Stock O
If O
we O
issue O
additional O
shares O
in O
the O
future O
" " O
it O
will O
result O
in O
the O
dilution O
of O
our O
existing O
shareholders O
. O

Our O
articles O
authorize O
the O
issuance O
of O
up O
to O
"100 000 000" O
shares O
of O
common O
stock O
and O
"30 000 000" O
class O
A O
special O
voting O
stock O
. O

Our O
board O
of O
directors O
may O
choose O
to O
issue O
some O
or O
all O
of O
such O
shares O
to O
acquire O
one O
or O
more O
businesses O
or O
to O
provide O
additional O
financing O
in O
the O
future O
. O

The O
issuance O
of O
any O
such O
shares O
will O
result O
in O
a O
reduction O
of O
the O
book O
value O
and O
market O
price O
of O
the O
outstanding O
shares O
of O
our O
common O
stock O
. O

If O
we O
issue O
any O
such O
additional O
shares O
" " O
such O
issuance O
will O
cause O
a O
reduction O
in O
the O
proportionate O
ownership O
and O
voting O
power O
of O
all O
current O
shareholders O
. O

Further O
" " O
such O
issuance O
may O
result O
in O
a O
change O
of O
control O
of O
our O
corporation O
. O

Trading O
of O
our O
stock O
may O
be O
restricted O
by O
the O
Securities I-GOVERNMENT
Exchange I-GOVERNMENT
Commission I-GOVERNMENT
's O
penny O
stock O
regulations O
" " O
which O
may O
limit O
a O
stockholder O
's O
ability O
to O
buy O
and O
sell O
our O
stock O
. O

The O
Securities I-GOVERNMENT
and I-GOVERNMENT
Exchange I-GOVERNMENT
Commission I-GOVERNMENT
has O
adopted O
regulations O
which O
generally O
define O
`` O
penny O
stock O
'' O
to O
be O
any O
equity O
security O
that O
has O
a O
market O
price O
( O
as O
defined O
) O
less O
than O
$ O
5.00 O
per O
share O
or O
an O
exercise O
price O
of O
less O
than O
$ O
5.00 O
per O
share O
" " O
subject O
to O
certain O
exceptions O
. O

Our O
securities O
are O
covered O
by O
the O
penny O
stock O
rules O
" " O
which O
impose O
additional O
sales O
practice O
requirements O
on O
broker-dealers O
who O
sell O
to O
persons O
other O
than O
established O
customers O
and O
`` O
accredited O
investors O
'' O
. O

The O
term O
`` O
accredited O
investor O
'' O
refers O
generally O
to O
institutions O
with O
assets O
in O
excess O
of O
$ O
"5 000 000" O
or O
individuals O
with O
a O
net O
worth O
in O
excess O
of O
$ O
"1 000 000" O
or O
annual O
income O
exceeding O
$ O
"200 000" O
or O
$ O
"300 000" O
jointly O
with O
their O
spouse O
. O

The O
penny O
stock O
rules O
require O
a O
broker-dealer O
" " O
prior O
to O
a O
transaction O
in O
a O
penny O
stock O
not O
otherwise O
exempt O
from O
the O
rules O
" " O
to O
deliver O
a O
standardized O
risk O
disclosure O
document O
in O
a O
form O
prepared O
by O
the O
Securities I-GOVERNMENT
and I-GOVERNMENT
Exchange I-GOVERNMENT
Commission I-GOVERNMENT
" " O
which O
provides O
information O
about O
penny O
stocks O
and O
the O
nature O
and O
level O
of O
risks O
in O
the O
penny O
stock O
market O
. O

The O
broker-dealer O
also O
must O
provide O
the O
customer O
with O
current O
bid O
and O
offer O
quotations O
for O
the O
penny O
stock O
" " O
the O
compensation O
of O
the O
broker-dealer O
and O
its O
salesperson O
in O
the O
transaction O
and O
monthly O
account O
statements O
showing O
the O
market O
value O
of O
each O
penny O
stock O
held O
in O
the O
customer O
's O
account O
. O

The O
bid O
and O
offer O
quotations O
" " O
and O
the O
broker-dealer O
and O
salesperson O
compensation O
information O
" " O
must O
be O
given O
to O
the O
customer O
orally O
or O
in O
writing O
prior O
to O
effecting O
the O
transaction O
and O
must O
be O
given O
to O
the O
customer O
in O
writing O
before O
or O
with O
the O
customer O
's O
confirmation O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
the O
penny O
stock O
rules O
require O
that O
prior O
to O
a O
transaction O
in O
a O
penny O
stock O
not O
otherwise O
exempt O
from O
these O
rules O
" " O
the O
broker-dealer O
must O
make O
a O
special O
written O
determination O
that O
the O
penny O
stock O
is O
a O
suitable O
investment O
for O
the O
purchaser O
and O
receive O
the O
purchaser O
's O
written O
agreement O
to O
the O
transaction O
. O

These O
disclosure O
requirements O
may O
have O
the O
effect O
of O
reducing O
the O
level O
of O
trading O
activity O
in O
the O
secondary O
market O
for O
the O
stock O
that O
is O
subject O
to O
these O
penny O
stock O
rules O
. O

Consequently O
" " O
these O
penny O
stock O
rules O
may O
affect O
the O
ability O
of O
broker-dealers O
to O
trade O
our O
securities O
. O

We O
believe O
that O
the O
penny O
stock O
rules O
discourage O
investor O
interest O
in O
and O
limit O
the O
marketability O
of O
our O
common O
stock O
. O

FINRA I-ORG
sales O
practice O
requirements O
may O
also O
limit O
a O
stockholder O
's O
ability O
to O
buy O
and O
sell O
our O
stock O
. O

In O
addition O
to O
the O
`` O
penny O
stock O
'' O
rules O
described O
above O
" " O
the O
Financial I-ORG
Industry I-ORG
Regulatory I-ORG
Authority I-ORG
( O
FINRA I-ORG
) O
" " O
formerly O
the O
National I-ORG
Association I-ORG
of I-ORG
Securities I-ORG
Dealers I-ORG
or O
NASD I-ORG
" " O
has O
adopted O
rules O
that O
require O
that O
in O
recommending O
an O
investment O
to O
a O
customer O
" " O
a O
broker-dealer O
must O
have O
reasonable O
grounds O
for O
believing O
that O
the O
investment O
is O
suitable O
for O
that O
customer O
. O

Prior O
to O
recommending O
speculative O
low O
priced O
securities O
to O
their O
non-institutional O
customers O
" " O
broker-dealers O
must O
make O
reasonable O
efforts O
to O
obtain O
information O
about O
the O
customer O
's O
financial O
status O
" " O
tax O
status O
" " O
investment O
objectives O
and O
other O
information O
. O

Under O
interpretations O
of O
these O
rules O
" " O
the O
FINRA I-ORG
believes O
that O
there O
is O
a O
high O
probability O
that O
speculative O
low O
priced O
securities O
will O
not O
be O
suitable O
for O
at O
least O
some O
customers O
. O

FINRA I-ORG
requirements O
make O
it O
more O
difficult O
for O
broker-dealers O
to O
recommend O
that O
their O
customers O
buy O
our O
common O
stock O
" " O
which O
may O
limit O
your O
ability O
to O
buy O
and O
sell O
our O
stock O
and O
have O
an O
adverse O
effect O
on O
the O
market O
for O
our O
shares O
. O

Our O
common O
stock O
is O
illiquid O
and O
the O
price O
of O
our O
common O
stock O
may O
be O
negatively O
impacted O
by O
factors O
which O
are O
unrelated O
to O
our O
operations O
. O

Our O
common O
stock O
currently O
trades O
on O
a O
limited O
basis O
on O
the O
OTC I-MISC
Bulletin I-MISC
Board I-MISC
. O

Trading O
of O
our O
stock O
through O
the O
OTC I-MISC
Bulletin I-MISC
Board I-MISC
is O
frequently O
thin O
and O
highly O
volatile O
. O

There O
is O
no O
assurance O
that O
a O
sufficient O
market O
will O
develop O
in O
the O
stock O
" " O
in O
which O
case O
it O
could O
be O
difficult O
for O
shareholders O
to O
sell O
their O
stock O
. O

The O
market O
price O
of O
our O
common O
stock O
could O
fluctuate O
substantially O
due O
to O
a O
variety O
of O
factors O
" " O
including O
market O
perception O
of O
our O
ability O
to O
achieve O
our O
planned O
growth O
" " O
quarterly O
operating O
results O
of O
our O
competitors O
" " O
trading O
volume O
in O
our O
common O
stock O
" " O
changes O
in O
general O
conditions O
in O
the O
economy O
and O
the O
financial O
markets O
or O
other O
developments O
affecting O
our O
competitors O
or O
us O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
the O
stock O
market O
is O
subject O
to O
extreme O
price O
and O
volume O
fluctuations O
. O

This O
volatility O
has O
had O
a O
significant O
effect O
on O
the O
market O
price O
of O
securities O
issued O
by O
many O
companies O
for O
reasons O
unrelated O
to O
their O
operating O
performance O
and O
could O
have O
the O
same O
effect O
on O
our O
common O
stock O
. O

Trends O
" " O
Risks O
and O
Uncertainties O
We O
have O
sought O
to O
identify O
what O
we O
believe O
to O
be O
the O
most O
significant O
risks O
to O
our O
business O
" " O
but O
we O
can O
not O
predict O
whether O
" " O
or O
to O
what O
extent O
" " O
any O
of O
such O
risks O
may O
be O
realized O
nor O
can O
we O
guarantee O
that O
we O
have O
identified O
all O
possible O
risks O
that O
might O
arise O
. O

Investors O
should O
carefully O
consider O
all O
of O
such O
risk O
factors O
before O
making O
an O
investment O
decision O

to O
